title: Where did the phrase 'Oh snap' originate? - Quora
tags: Etymology of English Phrases (Origin or History of English Phrases)

response.answer_text: Ans: There is so many originate of “OH SNAP” on Dictionary. But there's also has two different well known originate of “OH SNAP” Let's get started. … __________________________________________________ (exclamatory phrase) a playful indication of surprise, misfortune, or insultpopularized by Tracy Morgan of Saturday Night Live, OH SNAP is seemingly derivative of oh no you didn't where an insulted person, for example a guest of Jerry Springer or often a spunky African American woman contends the insult being made against him/her. While derivative of "oh no you di-int," OH SNAP has more of an emphasis on playfulness and can be said by people other than those being insulted. By DT, june 14,2014 (Source: Urban Dictionary) 2. First known usage was by the 1980′s rap song "Just friend" by Biz Markie. Its a "rated G" way of saying "oh shit" So I came to her room and opened the door Oh, snap! guess what I saw? A fella tongue-kissin’ my girl in the mouth, I was so im shock my heart went down south So please listen to the message that I say Don’t ever talk to a girl who says she just has a friend. By Leandro, October 3, 2004 (Source: Urban Dictionary) ~END~ Thanks for reading with your valuable time. Hope i helped you to get an answer.
